programme.title: Elvis Presley, Up Close and Personal
programme.desc: This unique film review draws on rare concert archive film of Elvis Presley in performance and documentary footage from television and radio archives around the world.

programme.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers, Phenomenon
programme.desc: This is the powerful independent critical review of the Red Hot Chili Peppers on record, on stage and on film. Drawing on live performance footage drawn from Woodstock and Red Square.

programme.desc: In the late 1960s and 1970s, Curved Air led the way as one of the foremost exponents of progressive rock. This comprehensive review combines exclusive insights from Sonja Kristina Linwood, Darryl Way,

programme.title: The Rolling Stones In Performance
programme.desc: With the best of the onstage footage from the last 30 years, Bob Harris serves up a rare archive interview with Jagger and Brian Jones.

programme.title: The Beatles Phenomenon
programme.desc: This exclusive film brings new, fresh and a different insight into the Beatles phenomenon.

programme.title: Queen One Vision
programme.desc: One Vision is a complete review of all Queen’s albums with realms of archival interview and performance footage

programme.title: Whitesnake The Ultimate Review
programme.desc: Featuring a wealth of rare interviews with David Coverdale and the reflections of bassist Neil Murray alongside a team of leading critics and working musicians.

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix Smash Hits
programme.desc: Smash Hits was the only compilation to be made prior to Hendrix’s death and in this comprehensive retrospective, you can experience the best of the music in the company of Jimi.
